title: IndiVisible : African-Native American lives in the Americas
subject: African Americans -- Relations with Indians
Indians of North America -- History
African Americans -- History
United States -- Ethnic relations
America -- Ethnic relations
Indians of North America -- Ethnic identity
African Americans -- Race identity
Indians of North America -- Mixed descent -- History
Indians of North America -- Social conditions
African Americans -- Social conditions
format: 256 p. : ill. (some col.), col. maps ; 24 cm.
publisher: Washington, D.C. : Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of the American Indian in association with the National Museum of African American History and Culture and the Smithsonian Institution Traveling Exhibition Service
contents: Race and policy -- Native Americans, African Americans, and Jim Crow / Theda Perdue -- Taino-African intersections : elite constructs and resurgent identities / Jose Barreiro -- Blacking out history / Bethany Montagano -- Racial legibility : the federal census and the (trans)formation of "Black" and "Indian" identity, 1790-1950 / Angela Gonzales -- Blended families, blended histories : documenting Black Indian families / Angela Walton-Raji -- Of shadows and doubts : race, indigeneity, and White supremacy / Brian Klopotek -- Community -- History and continuity : being Garifuna and Black Indian in the United States / Joseph Palacio -- Rotihnahon:tsi and Rotinonhson:ni : the historic relationship between African Americans and the Confederacy of the Six Nations / Richard W. Hill, Sr. -- Claiming the name : White supremacy, tribal identity, and racial policy in the early twentieth-century Chesapeake / Gabrielle Tayac -- Race, citizenship, and sovereignty in the Cherokee Nation / Mark Hirsch -- The Cherokee Nation under siege / Dan Agent -- The Cherokee freedmen : Cherokee citizens by treaty / Daniel Littlefield -- Creative resistance -- Taking leave, making lives : creative quests for freedom in early Black and Native America / Tiya Miles -- Red, Black, and Brown : artists and the aesthetics of race / Phoebe Farris -- Lifeways -- What is a Black Indian? : misplaced expectations and lived realities / Robert Keith Collins -- Afro-Bolivians revitalize their cultural identity / Peter McFarren -- Native Americans in jazz, blues, and popular music / Ron Welburn -- Red power/Black power : the people, the land, and the movement / Penny Gamble-Williams.

The buffalo soldiers / Herman Viola -- DNA and Native American identity / Kimberly TallBear -- Behind the rolls : Pompey Bruner Fixico / Kevin Mulroy -- Charles Chesnutt's Mandy Oxendine / Judy Kertesz -- Personal profile / Sam DeVenney -- Sarann Knight Preddy / Tiffini Bowers -- We heard it in the fields : the Native American roots of the blues / Morgan Peters (Mwalim) -- Poem: "Bones and drums" / Ron Welburn.

pub: Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of the American Indian in association with the National Museum of African American History and Culture and the Smithsonian Institution Traveling Exhibition Service
